examples: तिमी कफी अथवा चिया खाने?
examplesRomanized: timi kafi athawa chiya khane?
exampleEnglish: Will you have coffee or tea?

examples: विद्या तथा खेल दुवैमा उनी राम्रो छ।
examplesRomanized: vidya tatha khel duvema uni ramro chha.
exampleEnglish: He is good in both studies and sports.

examples: म जान चाहन्थें, तर समय भएन।
examplesRomanized: ma jan chahanthe, tara samaya bhaena.
exampleEnglish: I wanted to go, but I didn't have time.

examples: यदि पानी पर्‍यो भने खेल स्थगित हुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: yadi pani paryo bhane khel sthagit hunchha.
exampleEnglish: If it rains, the match will be postponed.

examples: तिमी वा म मध्ये को जाने?
examplesRomanized: timi wa ma madhye ko jane?
exampleEnglish: Who will go, you or me?

examples: आमा र बुबा आउँदै हुनुहुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: ama ra buba aundai hunuhunchha.
exampleEnglish: Mother and father are on their way.

examples: म घरमै छु किनभने वर्षा भइरहेको छ।
examplesRomanized: ma gharmai chu kinabhane varsha bhairaheko chha.
exampleEnglish: I am at home because it is raining.

examples: जब म सानो थिएँ, म गाउँमा बस्दथे।
examplesRomanized: jaba ma sano thiye, ma gauma basdthe.
exampleEnglish: When I was small, I used to live in the village.

examples: यद्यपि ऊ बिरामी छ, उसले काम गर्यो।
examplesRomanized: yadyapi uu birami chha, usle kaam garyo.
exampleEnglish: Although he is sick, he did the work.

examples: छिटो नहिँड, तरकि समयमै पुग्न सक्ने छैनौं।
examplesRomanized: chhito nahind, tarki samaymai pugna sakne chainaun.
exampleEnglish: Walk quickly, otherwise we won’t reach on time.

examples: साथी तथा शिक्षकसाथै आमाबुबा पनि आए।
examplesRomanized: saathi tatha shikshak sathai aama buba pani aaye.
exampleEnglish: Friends as well as teachers and parents came.

examples: तिमी पढ्यौं नत्र परीक्षा असफल हुनेछ।
examplesRomanized: timi padhyaun natra pariksha asafal hunechha.
exampleEnglish: You must study, otherwise you will fail the exam.

examples: ऊ खेल्दैछ, जबकि म पढ्दैछु।
examplesRomanized: uu kheldaichha, jabki ma padhdaichhu.
exampleEnglish: He is playing while I am studying.

examples: ऊ उठ्यो अनि नास्ता खायो।
examplesRomanized: uu uthyo ani naasta khayo.
exampleEnglish: He got up and then had breakfast.

examples: बर्षा परिरहेको छ, त्यसैले हामी घरमै छौं।
examplesRomanized: varsha pariraheko chha, tyasaile haami gharmai chhau.
exampleEnglish: It is raining, therefore we are at home.

examples: उसले साथी संगै खाना खायो।
examplesRomanized: usle saathi sangai khana khayo.
exampleEnglish: He ate food along with his friend.

definitions: so that; in such a way that
examples: ऊ यसरी बोल्यो, यस्तो कि सबैले सुन्न सके।
examplesRomanized: uu yasari bolyo, yasto ki sabailai sunna sake.
exampleEnglish: He spoke in such a way that everyone could hear.

definitions: because of which; due to which
examples: बर्खा परेको छ, जसको कारण खेल स्थगित भयो।
examplesRomanized: barkha pareko chha, jasko karan khel sthagit bhayo.
exampleEnglish: It rained, because of which the match was postponed.

examples: म बिरामी छु, यसकारण स्कूल गएन।
examplesRomanized: ma birami chu, yaskaran school gaena.
exampleEnglish: I am sick, hence I did not go to school.

examples: वर्षा परिरहेको छ, तर पनि हामी गए।
examplesRomanized: varsha pariraheko chha, tara pani haami gaye.
exampleEnglish: It is raining, but still we went.

examples: ऊ जसरी खेल्यो, त्यसरी म प्रयास गरें।
examplesRomanized: uu jasari khelyo, tysari ma prayas gare.
exampleEnglish: I tried the way he played.

examples: म जान सकिन किनकि म बिरामी छु।
examplesRomanized: ma jan sakin kinki ma birami chu.
exampleEnglish: I couldn’t go because I am sick.

definitions: for this reason also; hence also
examples: म व्यस्त छु, यसैले पनि म आउँदिन।
examplesRomanized: ma byasta chu, tyasaile pani ma aaundin.
exampleEnglish: I am busy, hence also I will not come.

examples: तिमी जसरी पनि आउँछौ।
examplesRomanized: timi jasari pani aauchhau.
exampleEnglish: You will come anyway.

examples: ऊ न त खान्छ, न त पिउँछ।
examplesRomanized: uu na ta khanchha, na ta piunchha.
exampleEnglish: He neither eats nor drinks.

examples: ऊ हाँस्छ र साथसाथै गुनासो गर्छ।
examplesRomanized: uu haanschha ra sathasathai gunaso garchha.
exampleEnglish: He laughs and complains at the same time.

definitions: because of which; due to which
examples: सडक बिग्रियो, जसले गर्दा ट्राफिक जाम भयो।
examplesRomanized: sadak bigriyo, jasle garda traffic jam bhayo.
exampleEnglish: The road got damaged, because of which traffic jam occurred.

examples: बजार र घरको विच दूरी धेरै छ।
examplesRomanized: bajar ra gharko vich duri dherai chha.
exampleEnglish: The distance between the market and home is large.

examples: ऊ आमासस्तै दयालु छ।
examplesRomanized: uu aama jastai dayalu chha.
exampleEnglish: He is kind like his mother.

examples: बिना अनुमति नजानु।
examplesRomanized: bina anumati najanu.
exampleEnglish: Do not go without permission.

examples: ऊ चाँडै आउँछ, राम चाहिँ ढिला।
examplesRomanized: uu chadai aauchha, Ram chahi dhila.
exampleEnglish: He comes early, whereas Ram is late.

examples: हामी घरसम्म हिँड्यौं।
examplesRomanized: haami ghar samma hidyau.
exampleEnglish: We walked up to the house.

examples: पहिला पढ, त्यसपछि खेल।
examplesRomanized: pahila padh, tyaspachi khel.
exampleEnglish: Study first, then play.

examples: ऊ पढ्छ अनि पनि काम गर्छ।
examplesRomanized: uu padhchha ani pani kaam garchha.
exampleEnglish: He studies and also works.

examples: पानी पर्‍यो, त्यसपछि पनि खेल भयो।
examplesRomanized: pani paryo, tyaspachi pani khel bhayo.
exampleEnglish: It rained, but even after that, the game continued.

examples: तत्काल घर फर्क।
examplesRomanized: tatkaal ghar fark.
exampleEnglish: Return home immediately.

examples: तिमी वा त ऊ आउँछ।
examplesRomanized: timi wa ta uu aauchha.
exampleEnglish: Either you or he will come.

examples: मले प्रश्न सोधेँ, अझै पनि उत्तर पाएन।
examplesRomanized: male prashna sodhe, ajhai pani uttar paena.
exampleEnglish: I asked the question, but even now did not get an answer.

examples: ऊ दुवै परीक्षा पास भयो, तसर्थ हामी खुशी छौं।
examplesRomanized: uu dubai pariksha pass bhayo, tasartha haami khushi chhau.
exampleEnglish: He passed both exams, therefore we are happy.

examples: ऊ राम्ररी सुत्यो, न कि थकित थियो।
examplesRomanized: uu ramrari sutyo, na ki thakit thiyo.
exampleEnglish: He slept well, not that he was tired.

examples: म न त खाऊँछु, न त पिउँछु।
examplesRomanized: ma na ta khaunchhu, na ta piunchhu.
exampleEnglish: I will neither eat nor drink.

examples: जति काम गरेँ, त्यति सन्तुष्ट भएँ।
examplesRomanized: jati kaam gare, tyati santusht bhaye.
exampleEnglish: However much work I did, I felt satisfied.

examples: ऊ आए अनि त हामीले खाना खायौँ।
examplesRomanized: uu aaye ani ta haamile khana khayaun.
exampleEnglish: He came and then we had food.

examples: म थकित छु, अझै पनि तर काम गर्छु।
examplesRomanized: ma thakit chu, ajhai pani tara kaam garchhu.
exampleEnglish: I am tired, yet still I work.

definitions: so much that; to the extent that
examples: उसले यति काम गर्यो कि सबैले सराहना गरे।
examplesRomanized: usle yati kaam garyo ki sabailai sarahana gare.
exampleEnglish: He worked so much that everyone appreciated.

examples: उसले यसरी लेख्यो कि सबैले बुझ्न सके।
examplesRomanized: usle yasari lekhyo ki sabailai bujhna sake.
exampleEnglish: He wrote in such a way that everyone could understand.

examples: यद्यपि ऊ थकित छ, तर अझै दौडिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: yadyapi uu thakit chha, tara ajhai daudinchha.
exampleEnglish: Although he is tired, yet he still runs.

examples: तिमी जसरी पनि आउँछौ तर ढिला हुनेछ।
examplesRomanized: timi jasari pani aauchhau tara dhila hunechha.
exampleEnglish: You will come anyway, but it will be late.

examples: पानी पर्‍यो, त्यसैले कि खेल स्थगित भयो।
examplesRomanized: pani paryo, tyasaile ki khel sthagit bhayo.
exampleEnglish: It rained, because of that the game was postponed.

definitions: because of which; due to which
examples: सडक बन्द भयो, जसको कारणले हामी ढिला भयौं।
examplesRomanized: sadak band bhayo, jasko kaaranle haami dhila bhayau.
exampleEnglish: The road was closed, due to which we were late.

examples: जति म पढ्छु, त्यति म बुझ्छु।
examplesRomanized: jati ma padhchhu, tyati ma bujhchhu.
exampleEnglish: The more I study, the more I understand.

examples: जसरी ऊ नाच्छ, त्यसरी म पनि नाच्छु।
examplesRomanized: jasari uu naachchha, tysari ma pani naachchhu.
exampleEnglish: Just as he dances, I also dance.

examples: ऊ ठुलो कुरा जान्दाजस्तो देखिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: uu thulo kura jandajasto dekhchha.
exampleEnglish: He seems to know big things, as if knowledgeable.

definitions: however much; no matter how much
examples: जति म पढ्छु भए पनि नजिकको परीक्षा पास गर्न सक्दिन।
examplesRomanized: jati ma padhchhu bhae pani najikko pariksha pass garn sakdina.
exampleEnglish: However much I study, I cannot pass the nearby exam.

examples: पहिला काम गरौँ, त्यसपश्चात आराम गरौँ।
examplesRomanized: pahila kaam garaun, tyaspashchat aaram garaun.
exampleEnglish: First, let's work, and thereafter let's rest.

examples: छिटो आउ, अथवा त हामी जान्छौं।
examplesRomanized: chhito aaun, athawa ta haami jaaunchhau.
exampleEnglish: Come quickly, or else we will leave.

examples: समय कम छ, तर खैर हामी पूरा गर्छौं।
examplesRomanized: samaya kam chha, tara khair haami poora garchhau.
exampleEnglish: Time is short, but anyway we will finish.

examples: अहिले पढौं, त्यसपछि खेलौं।
examplesRomanized: ahile padhau, tyaspachi khelau.
exampleEnglish: First let's study now, then play.

examples: अहिले त म व्यस्त छु।
examplesRomanized: ahile ta ma vyast chu.
exampleEnglish: I am busy at this moment.

examples: जहाँ म जान्छु, त्यहाँ ऊ पनि जान्छ।
examplesRomanized: jaha ma janchhu, tyaha uu pani janchha.
exampleEnglish: Wherever I go, he also goes there.

examples: तपाईं बस्नुहुन्छ जबसम्म म फर्किएँ।
examplesRomanized: tapai basnuhunchha jabasamma ma farkie.
exampleEnglish: You stay until I return.

examples: यसबाहेक अन्य कुरा विचार गर्न सक्दैन।
examplesRomanized: yasbahek anya kura bichar garn sakdaina.
exampleEnglish: Apart from this, he cannot consider other matters.

examples: जबसम्म म आउँछु, तबसम्म पर्ख।
examplesRomanized: jabasamma ma aauchhu, tabsamma parkh.
exampleEnglish: Wait until I arrive.

examples: ऊ राम्रो छ, अझ दयालु पनि छ।
examplesRomanized: uu ramro chha, ajha dayalu pani chha.
exampleEnglish: He is good, moreover he is also kind.

definitions: for now; for the time being
examples: अहिलेका लागि योजना रोकौं।
examplesRomanized: ahileka lagi yojana rokaun.
exampleEnglish: Let's pause the plan for now.

examples: मानिस जसले मेहेनत गर्छ, सफल हुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: manish jasle mehenat garchha, safal hunchha.
exampleEnglish: The person who works hard succeeds.

examples: तिमी वा म वा बजार जाउँ।
examplesRomanized: timi wa ma wa bazar jaau.
exampleEnglish: Either you or I will go to the market.

examples: जति म अभ्यास गर्छु, उति म राम्रो हुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: jati ma abhyas garchhu, uti ma ramro hunchhu.
exampleEnglish: The more I practice, the better I get.

examples: यद्यपि ऊ थाकेको छ, तैपनि ऊ खेल्छ।
examplesRomanized: yadyapi u thakeko chha, taipani u khelchha.
exampleEnglish: Although he is tired, he still plays.

examples: ऊ न पढ्छ नकि काम गर्छ।
examplesRomanized: u na padhchha naki kaam garchha.
exampleEnglish: He neither studies nor works.

examples: यद्यपि ऊ थाकेको छ, तर काम गर्छ।
examplesRomanized: yadyapi u thakeko chha, tara kaam garchha.
exampleEnglish: Although he is tired, yet he works.

examples: जसका कारण यात्रा ढिला भयो, उसलाई माफ गर्नुपर्छ।
examplesRomanized: jaska karan yatra dhila bhayo, uslai maaf garnu parchha.
exampleEnglish: The person because of whom the trip was delayed should be forgiven.

examples: म धेरै व्यस्त छु, त्यसकारण आउन सक्दिन।
examplesRomanized: ma dherai byast chhu, tyaskaran aaun sakdina.
exampleEnglish: I am very busy; hence, I cannot come.

examples: म काम गर्छु, अर्कोतिर ऊ खेल्छ।
examplesRomanized: ma kaam garchhu, arkotir u khelchha.
exampleEnglish: I work; on the other hand, he plays.

examples: ऊ खेल्छ जबकी म पढ्छु।
examplesRomanized: u khelchha jabki ma padhchhu.
exampleEnglish: He plays while I study.
